qas.question: Whose death in 1779 led to a civil war in Iran?
Who founded the following Qajar Empire in 1794?
The Qajars defeated the Russians at what battle to take over Tblisi?
The Qajars drove the Russians out of what entire region?
Iran lost territory in the Caucasus during what wars in the early 1800s?

context: Another civil war ensued after the death of <a0_0>Karim Khan<a0_0/> in 1779, out of which <a1_0>Aqa Mohammad Khan<a1_0/> emerged, founding the Qajar Dynasty in 1794. In 1795, following the disobedience of the Georgian subjects and their alliance with the Russians, the Qajars captured Tblisi by the <a2_0>Battle of Krtsanisi<a2_0/>, and drove the Russians out of <a3_0>the entire Caucasus<a3_0/>, reestablishing a short-lived Iranian suzerainty over the region. The <a4_0>Russo-Persian wars<a4_0/> of 1804–1813 and 1826–1828 resulted in large irrevocable territorial losses for Iran in the Caucasus, comprising all of Transcaucasia and Dagestan, which made part of the very concept of Iran for centuries, and thus substantial gains for the neighboring Russian Empire.
